You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Serve Friendly URLs for Storefront Pages

Boost your storefront’s SEO ranking by serving URLs that are human-readable, include keywords, and reflect taxonomies. This information provides search engines with valuable insight into the content and structure of your storefront. You can specify friendly URL paths for products and categories. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses these paths in URLs for the Product List page and the Product Detail page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration


To set default sharing access:	Manage Sharing

For example, the default URL to a Product Detail page includes several parameters, such as product SKU.

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later
https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductDetails?sku=E-ESP-001&cclcl=en_US
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier
https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductDetails?viewState=DetailView&cartID=&portalUser=&store=&cclcl=en_US&sku=E-ESP-001

A human-friendly URL shows a clear taxonomy path including storefront name, category name, and product name, without the noisy parameters.

https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/Espresso/EastonMachine
NOTE Friendly URLs propagate to your canonical URLs and dynamic sitemaps, and promotions. In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, friendly URLs also propagate to alternate language link URLs.
To specify the friendly URL values for individual products and categories, add SEO ID values to your product and category records.
TIP If your storefront supports multiple locales, add SEO ID values to your localized product and localized category records. B2B Commerce for Visualforce serves the localized friendly URL to users whose Language setting matches the enabled locale.
Enable the storefront configuration setting for friendly URLs.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select User Interface (3).
Find the Use Friendly URLs configuration (4), and find its value (5).
If Use Friendly URLs is TRUE, this setting is already enabled on your storefront. Skip the remaining steps.
If Use Friendly URLs is FALSE or doesn't exist, continue to the next step.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Interface
Configuration	Use Friendly URLs
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
To configure your Experience Cloud site to use friendly URLs instead of standard URLs, specify an Apex class for the site to rewrite URLs.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Click Workspaces next to your site, and then click the Administration workspace tile.
From the Administration menu, select Pages, and then click Go to Force.com.
In the site details, click Edit.
For URL Rewriter Class, enter or search for cc_FriendlyUrlRewriter, and click Save.
Create a sharing rule for guest user access to records of the CC Category, CC Product, and CC Site Index objects. Follow the steps in Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects.
NOTE These sharing rules are required for friendly URLs to work correctly. The cc_FriendlyUrlRewriter class that implements friendly URLs uses the same permissions as a guest user and reads records of these objects for constructing friendly URLs. If you've already created these sharing rules when you resolved the Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure by Default, skip this step.
To reflect the friendly URLs for categories on your storefront, refresh your site index records.
Extension Points for Friendly URLs
To modify the default implementation of friendly URLs, you can extend or override the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API methods that return URL and site index data.
